intro: Pluchea conocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its small yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pluchea conocephala is often found in moist, open habitats like grasslands and forest edges.
